title: AI for Everyone LESSON 9: Understanding Region of Interest (ROI) in OpenCV
author: Paul McWhorter
comment: Thanks for another step-by-step video through OPEN CV. Earned myself an enormous cabbage! Probably not but I was wondering if its possible to use vpython and its methods on a cv2 frame? Just thinking about the animations we are doing in that course and if they would ever meet?
Great lessson Paul. Thanks. I see the AI part coming our way. Enormous Cabbage.
From Arduino series of lessons through Raspberry Pi, Python and now AI. What a ride! Great content, thank you!
Thank you Paul. This is indeed an enormous Cabbage. Here's my solution to the homework : https://youtu.be/lC4tqRZcYKQ
Thank you Paul, can’t wait to start this series after I wrap up the Jetson lessons.  Would you consider teaching MATLAB in the future?
description: You guys can help me out over at Patreon, and that will help me keep my gear updated, and help me keep this quality content coming:
